events.message: The applicant has submitted a personal loan application to cover upcoming medical expenses and consolidate existing debt.
Loan application has been categorised under Personal Loan due to mention of medical bills and debt consolidation.
A dedicated loan officer has been assigned to assist the applicant throughout the personal loan process.
Initial review of the loan application has been conducted, verifying the purpose as personal medical and debt relief.
Applicant has been requested to submit medical bills, proof of income, and recent credit statements for verification.
Applicant submitted all requested documentation on time, including detailed medical invoices and income proof.
Credit check was completed, showing a moderately good credit score but some existing debts to be considered.
Risk assessment concluded that the applicant poses a moderate risk given previous debt but steady income.
An offer for a personal loan with a competitive interest rate and repayment plan tailored to the applicant’s needs was presented.
Applicant expressed agreement with the loan terms and requested clarification on the repayment schedule details.
The application was escalated to senior management due to the applicant’s request for a longer repayment term.
Senior management approved the personal loan application with a revised repayment schedule accommodating the applicant’s request.
Funds were successfully disbursed into the applicant’s bank account to be used for medical expenses and debt consolidation.
Follow-up call conducted with the applicant to ensure satisfaction with the loan and provide support for repayment planning.
The personal loan case was formally closed after confirming that the applicant received funds and understood the repayment terms.
